Alright, who the fuck let me win Narrative?

EDIT: Seriously though, this is amazing, and a great honor. Thank you, dear jury.

> [{quoted}](name=Blood Magicks,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UEE2sPcO,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-03-06T02:47:04.192+0000)
>
> Alright, who the fuck let me win Narrative?

Congratulations! :D
Hey Bio, do you know if Narrative planned to have an honorable mentions section?  I noticed some other categories had it but none in narrative.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UEE2sPcO,comment-id=000000010002,timestamp=2018-03-06T03:32:00.125+0000)
>
> Hey Bio, do you know if Narrative planned to have an honorable mentions section?  I noticed some other categories had it but none in narrative.

I'm gently inquiring, but I have no visibility into how the contest was judged or anything.  Might be a wait and see situation.

(Personally, everyone who entered should be bloody proud of completing a piece of creative fiction within the guidelines and time limit.  It may seem trivial, but completing anything is to be cheered - it can be so rewarding.  I'm notorious for only half finishing personal projects so you're all (non legally binding! :P ) winners in my book.)

I see. Thanks for responding Bio. 

Honestly I guess I’m just bummed because I don’t know where exactly I could improve on my piece.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UEE2sPcO,comment-id=00000001000200010002,timestamp=2018-03-06T16:16:06.527+0000)
>
> I see. Thanks for responding Bio. 
> 
> Honestly I guess I’m just bummed because I don’t know where exactly I could improve on my piece.

I get that.  Good to remember though that Riot isn't the only source for writing feedback - there are huge communities for such things - heck, if you were _evil_, you could maybe even ask Blood Magicks for some feedback while they're still in shock ;)

I didn't check every entry thread over on Polycount, but it did seem like quite a solitary exercise.  Maybe get a bunch of your peers together and provide each other with new perspectives and mutual help over in Concepts and Creations?  Like a writers salon.  

I know it's not the answer you wanted, but I can't just promise work from other Rioters.  This is the first time there was a Narrative category, so maybe think of it as a first tentative step to see how popular, valuable, and/or time-consuming committing to this is.  This is good feedback that, in the future, the community would appreciate some analysis, at least of a few of the pieces, for future improvement.

Oh we checked over each other’s pieces before we even submitted. 

I hope the narrative section remains in the future. It’s the only one I can feel I can compete in! Lol.

If you're gently inquiring, could you also gently inquire about reasons? One of the best things about the VFX contest results is the little blurbs talking about why a certain entry was picked. Without seeing those for narrative it's hard to tell, especially since there are so many different ways to write stories and so many things to focus on. It would be really helpful for those of us looking to enter in future years to see what the judges were really looking for.
I do agree yours deserved at least a mention, it was subtle, tasteful and well-written.
Honestly, I think I didn't point out Zed hard enough.

Otherwise you'd be worried you pointed him out too hard. In my opinion you can definitely tell it's him.

I'm on the other side of the fence here, too many of the initial readers didn't get some of the ideas so I made a lot of things _too_ obvious. I cringe every time I re-read it.
Thanks! I'm still struggling to accept the reality of it.
Congrats Bloody!  I really loved your piece and believe you wrote in a way that wasted no words.

Don't, it was a great piece.

I'm still super envious of you.

Hey, thanks a lot for the answer! 

Congratulations guys!
My mistake, I had placed that as a stand-in answer so I could find your comment and edit it in with the proper list. Looks like somebody beat me to it, though.

Aye, these were all fantastic!

I only really have two pieces of criticism for Riot (besides, y'know, don't string us along for an extra four days!):

* I feel like criticism/feedback should be universal. It feels kind of disappointing when VFX has a bajillion categories and detailed feedback about why each won while environmental art doesn't even get an honorable mentions. (That makes it feel like there wasn't another good entry!)

* Maybe if you guys do narrative again, perhaps open up the field. It felt like a lot of what won were dialogue-heavy stories and that there was a strong preference to talkative scenes. Perhaps something like an action scene in addition to something more discussion heavy.

> Maybe if you guys do narrative again, perhaps open up the field. It felt like a lot of what won were dialogue-heavy stories and that there was a strong preference to talkative scenes. Perhaps something like an action scene in addition to something more discussion heavy.

Sadly, detailed action and a plot are a bit hard to fit in 1000 words. We'll see way better works if next year the word limit is bigger.

Yes please.

The world limit was one of the reasons I didn't bother submitting my draft.

> [{quoted}](name=Blood Magicks,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UEE2sPcO,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2018-03-06T10:03:52.446+0000)
>
> Sadly, detailed action and a plot are a bit hard to fit in 1000 words. We'll see way better works if next year the word limit is bigger.

Indeed they are. Although tbf I was just using that as an example. I do know some people excel at writing fight scenes while others excel at dialogue and characterization. I just hope Riot continues to do narrative justice.

Yeah, narrative was a bit difficult to not do dialogue. My initial plan was a dialogue light sequence focusing on struggle. Maybe a better writer than I could make it work, but at the end, I had to cut out about 700 words and changed some sections to be more dialogue focused in order to get the point across. 

End result is a bit of a mess. 

On the other hand, reading takes time. And there were a lot of narrative entries. Simply upping the word count by 500 means a 50% increase in time allocated to the project. And Riot was struggling to get just this one out 5 days late.

(Watches the animation to the third place winner)

............... Krang in LoL huh? Interesting.
Honestly I loved that concept simply for its hilarious design XD

Well, there goes all the effort I put into making something decent for Shen come to light.

Original rules for Narrative mentioned 1k words only

Well, these were hardly 300 words.

Mine was under 1k, but barely.
Click on the titles for the full thread where each full story has been uploaded.
Ah, thank you.
